bibl.title: Letter from Dorothy Allmand to Henry Rose Carter, March 1, 1919

div1.p: Allmand informs Carter about yellow fever publications.

div1.head: Letter from Dorothy Allmand to Henry Rose Carter, March 1, 1919
div1.opener:
Yellow Fever
Publication
THE INCORPORATED
LIVERPOOL SCHOOL OF TROPICAL MEDICINE.
_____________________________________
PROFESSOR J. W. W. STEPHENS, M.D., D.P.M.,
TROPICAL MEDICINE.
PROFESSOR ROBERT NEWSTEAD, F.R.S., &,
ENTOMOLOGY.
PROFESSOR WARRINGTON YORKE, M.D.,
PARASITOLOGY.
--------
PROFESSOR RONALD ROSS, , ,
TROPICAL SANITATION.
Johnston Tropical Laboratory,
University of Liverpool.
TELEPHONE 611 NOVAL
TELEGRAMS: “MALARIA, LIVERPOOL”
March 1st 1919
Dear Sir,
div1.p: Your letter of February 15th has been handed to me.

The publications of the Yellow Fever Bureau (which no longer exists)
are as follows:
(1) Yellow Fever Bureau Bulletin:
vol I. 1911-12. (12 months, parts, some of which
are now out of priest)
II. 1912-13 (quarterly)
III. 1913-15 (quarterly)
(2) Yellow Fever Commission (West Africa) - Reports:
First, issued 1913
Second, " 1914
Third, " 1915
Fourth and Final, 1916
out
of
print (unless
The Publishers have
copies (I & A, Churchill
GR Marlborough, St. London.)
(3) Yellow Fever Commission (West Africa): Reports on Questions connected with the
Investigations of Non-Malarial Fevers in West Africa [Investigators' Reports]
vol. I, issued 29th May 1915 (pub. Liverpool)
II " 18th Aug. 1915 (pub. Liverpool)
III. " 1916 (pub. London)
div1.closer:
Yours faithfully, Dorothy Allmand
Librarian Dr H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
